description:
MultiMarkdown, or MMD, is a tool to help turn minimally marked-up plain text
into well formatted documents, including HTML, PDF (by way of [LaTeX](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LaTeX)),
[OPML](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OPML), or OpenDocument (specifically, Flat [OpenDocument](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenDocument) or ‘.fodt’, which
can in turn be converted into [RTF](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rich_Text_Format), Microsoft Word, or virtually any other
word-processing format).

MMD is a superset of the [Markdown](http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/) syntax, originally created by John Gruber.
It adds multiple syntax features (tables, footnotes, and citations, to name a
few), in addition to the various output formats listed above (Markdown only
creates HTML). Additionally, it builds in “smart” typography for various
languages (proper left- and right-sided quotes, for example).
summary: A tool to help turn minimally marked-up plain text into well formatted documents
author: Fletcher Penney
